item.title: San Francisco Symphony (March 5, 2010)
item.description: I bought my tickets for last night’s concert with the San Francisco Symphony last fall when I was under the spell of an almost child-like excitement over this season’s programming of popular masterworks. In particular, the 2009-2010 season has seen the symphonies of Tchaikovsky, Mahler, and Rachmaninoff, as well as a few other big names from the middle Romantic era. [caption id=“attachment_292” align=“aligncenter” width=“500” caption=“Christian Tetzlaff (alexandra-vosding.de)”] [/caption] The piece from last night’s concert that motivated my purchase was Tchaikovsky’s violin concerto, performed by Christian Tetzlaffâ€”a violinist of modest stature with a powerful sound.
